utterance.speaker: RICHARD CASTLE
utterance.content: You’re cooking. This must be a dream. Or perhaps a nightmare.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA RODGERS
utterance.content: I choose to take the higher ground and ignore that. Breakfast is served.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: These are my patented, special pancakes that I make for Alexis.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Well, not so special. I learned how to prepare it for her this past year.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ah. The student becomes – – the failed student. The dropout. You fed her this? Mother, you are forever forbidden from practicing the art of pancake dough.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Where did I go wrong?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Where do I begin? Alexis isn’t even here. Why are you making these?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You miss her.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh. Well, don’t you?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes, of course I do. But Columbia is just a cab ride away.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Well, she was the center of our lives for so long and now she is just … … gone.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Right now is just Alexis’ time to make her own way in the world. But she’ll be back. Like Simba in The Lion King. It’s the circle of life.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh darling.

utterance.speaker: KATE BECKETT
utterance.content: You seem to have adopted a real Zen-like attitude about this, Castle.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, I realized I’ve been a little overprotective of Alexis at times. Okay, constantly. But since she’s left for Columbia I‘ve learned to let go. You know, stop checking her video blog. I don’t ask to meet her boyfriend anymore. I’ve come to realize that like a bird, Alexis needed to leave the nest. So I let her fly. Turned around and strode away. That’s acceptance.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Wait, wouldn’t acceptance be letting her go, seeing where she flies, and then being okay with it?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, but I wouldn’t be okay with that. I don’t want to see where she goes. What other birds of prey are out there, or what other nests, or –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So is that acceptance or denial?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, it was acceptance ‘til you started applying your fiendish logic.

utterance.speaker: LANIE PARISH
utterance.content: How about you guys apply some fiendish logic to this. Meet Hasim Farouk, man versus van. At 1AM last night he was killed instantly.

utterance.speaker: JAVIER ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Knocked right out of his shoes at the point of impact.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So hit and run?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Well, that’s just the tip of the iceberg. A witness, homeless guy, said that the victim emptied his gun at the van and just stood in the middle of the street, shooting right until it hit him.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Why would he do that?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I don’t know, but he definitely knew his way around guns. Jan! This is a Sig P 220 S with a weight compensator, target sights, and custom molded grip to his hand. This was a serious shooter.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What else do we know about him?

utterance.speaker: KEVIN RYAN
utterance.content: Well, Hasim Farouk is a Saudi national living here as a student.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Majoring in what? Urban warfare?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Uh, undeclared, actually. Up at Columbia.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So what was he doing in lower Manhattan?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: More importantly, what is Columbia doing admitting gun toting lunatics and are there any more of them? For the record, I’m not calling to check on Alexis. I’m just checking my email.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Acceptance.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Have tech search traffic cam footage of that van and let’s look into Hasim Farouk’s life. See if he had any enemies.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Looks like he had at least one. Assault charges were filed against him two days ago by one - - Bram Stoker.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Bram Stoker, author of Dracula, died in 1912?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Uh, if it’s him I’d say he’s immortal.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Excuse me, Bram Stoker?

utterance.speaker: BRAM STOKER
utterance.content: Yeah?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Detective Kate Beckett, NYPD.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And might I say how youthful you look.

utterance.speaker: BRAM
utterance.content: Witty. I’ve never heard that one before.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’ve never heard of anyone named Stoker before, except Bram Stoker.

utterance.speaker: BRAM
utterance.content: Apparently he’s a distant relative and both my parents are English scholars. They thought it’d be cute. It wasn’t. So, what is this about?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The late Hasim Farouk.

utterance.speaker: BRAM
utterance.content: The late? He’s dead?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yes, he was murdered the day after you filed an assault charge against him.

utterance.speaker: BRAM
utterance.content: I certainly did not kill him. I filed those charges to protect myself.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: From what?

utterance.speaker: BRAM
utterance.content: Hasim was a student of mine. I’m a TA for a seminar on Joyce.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What was the problem with the two of you?

utterance.speaker: BRAM
utterance.content: I didn’t think that there was one, and then three days ago he confronts me after class. Starts accusing me of being … overly familiar with some female students. Said if I didn’t stop he’d kill me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: For harassing those women?

utterance.speaker: BRAM
utterance.content: No, I was not harassing them. I – I might flirt with students on occasion, but believe me, it was never unwelcome. Ladies are kind of digging on vampires right now and my name is Bram Stoker. For once in my life it’s working for me.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Maybe Hasim was jealous. Were any of those students his girlfriend?

utterance.speaker: BRAM
utterance.content: Uh, no. I don’t think he had a girlfriend. Or friends at all, for that matter.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: ‘kay, well I’m going to need a list of all the girls that you flirted with.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Look at this building. Hasim was living large for a college student.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, add that to the list of things about this dude that don’t add up. His records say he started as a freshman at 24. Now who does that?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Late bloomer?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Or a sleeper cell terrorist.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Think about it. Saudi national? He shot up a van with a customized Sig? I’m just saying, could be a terrorist.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Whoa.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Whoa! Look at all this gear. This guy practically has his own dojo.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Huh.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Uh, yeah. And if his black belt skills didn’t get it done he always had this.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Wow. That’s not all he’s got. Look. Surveillance gear.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Ooh. State of the art. Light years ahead of anything the department has.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah. Who the hell is this guy?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Look, the guns could have fit with terrorism, but the wiretapping equipment?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Maybe he’s a spy. He’s got military training. Says here he was a commando in the Saudi special forces.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: But then there’s this. $25 grand wired to him every month from a Swiss bank account. Whatever he was doing he was well funded.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What did his fellow students have to say?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, I talked to most of the girls on Bram Stoker’s list and none of them noticed Hasim in class or even knew who he was. It’s like the guy was invisible.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He was hiding in plain sight. Foreign agent in deep cover on some kind of special reconnaissance mission.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So then why would he shoot up a van?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Maybe Jack Bauer was driving.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yo, Ryan’s hunting through traffic cam footage looking for that van. In the meantime, things with Hasim keep getting weirder. Tech went over that surveillance gear. It looks like he was using it to monitor an active bug installed in some apartment about a half a mile from his place.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Whose apartment was it?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: According to the lease, it belonged to this chick. Sara El-Masri. I called and left a message on her cell phone.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Wait a minute, Sara El-Masri was one of the students in the Joyce class. She was one of the girls on Bram Stoker’s flirt list.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What did she say about Hasim?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I couldn’t reach her. I just left a message.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey guys? I got something here you need to see.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Unfortunately there were no traffic or security cams near the crime scene, but we did find this footage shot down the street from where Hasim was hit.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: That’s definitely the van that took him out. Front end’s all crunched up. You can see the bullet holes.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah, but watch this.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Wait – go back to where she ran out. Zoom in on her face. That’s Sara El-Masri. She was abducted.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And Hasim died trying to stop it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Whoever this is, he abducted a girl and he killed our victim. So what do we know about him from the video?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well he’s a male, late 30s, no distinguishing scars or tattoos. But we sent the footage over to the FBI, see if they can run it through their facial recognition software.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Are they updated on the abduction?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yes. And they’re sending over an agent to liaise. Meanwhile, we’re checking other traffic cams. See if we can track where that van went after Sara tried to escape.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hasim was surveilling her apartment and he was nearby when she was kidnapped, but why? What was their relationship?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well, Sara’s roommate’s coming in. Maybe she has an answer. There were no phone calls between them. It’s looking like more like he was stalking her. Not only did he wiretap her place, he was also taking two classes that she was in.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Maybe he’s like The Conversation.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I’m sorry, I don’t –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Francis Ford Coppola.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Gene Hackman. Very underrated.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Thank you. Um, in it a surveillance expert overhears a plot against the woman he’s bugging. Maybe Hasim got wind of the kidnapping, tried to thwart it, and paid with his life.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Ah, that still doesn’t explain the guns in his apartment.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: True. Gene Hackman did not possess an arsenal.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: So it could be that Hasim was in on the kidnapping. And it went sideways. Or he got cold feet.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: All right, dig into his emails and phone records. Let’s see who he was in touch with.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: On it.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So, here’s what I’ve dug up on Sara El-Masri. She’s a sophomore majoring in marine biology. She was born in Cairo to an über-wealthy Egyptian family.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So this could have been a kidnapping for ransom. Where are her parents?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: The El-Masris have a place at the Dakota. They’re on their way in now.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And we’re doing everything that we can to make that happen, Mr. El-Masri. Along with the FBI.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, so far we know that at least two people were involved. The driver and this man. Does he look familiar to you?

utterance.speaker: ANWAR
utterance.content: No, not to me. Lina?

utterance.speaker: LINA
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: ANWAR
utterance.content: I will pay them. I will pay whatever they ask.

utterance.speaker: LINA
utterance.content: What if that isn’t what they want? You’ve made enemies, Anwar.

utterance.speaker: ANWAR
utterance.content: In Egypt. Not here. This is about money. It is always about money.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s also about this man. Hasim Farouk. Have you ever seen him?

utterance.speaker: ANWAR
utterance.content: Yes, I tried to reach Hasim when I learned of this. Perhaps he can help us. If he –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Wait, you know him?

utterance.speaker: ANWAR
utterance.content: Sara would not accept a bodyguard, so I hired Hasim to watch over her discreetly. Where is he?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He died trying to protect her.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Now, you hired him to guard Sara. Was she receiving threats?

utterance.speaker: ANWAR
utterance.content: No. But a man in my position … I – I begged Sara to be careful. But she said, “Papa, you worry too much”. She thinks like an American. Trusts like an American. I will pay anything.

utterance.speaker: ANWAR
utterance.content: She’s my only child. Please.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Would you excuse us for a second?

utterance.speaker: CAPTAIN VICTORIA GATES
utterance.content: Detective Beckett, Mr. Castle. This is Agent Harris. He’ll be running point on the kidnapping.

utterance.speaker: FBI AGENT HARRIS
utterance.content: Good to meet you. Detective Ryan brought me up to speed on things. How are the El-Masris?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Scared. Devastated.

utterance.speaker: HARRIS
utterance.content: Okay, that’s good.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It is?

utterance.speaker: HARRIS
utterance.content: It beats angry or defensive. They want to be helpful and honest, which is important. Because at the end of the day it’s the accuracy of our information that can determine if this ends well or badly. I’ll keep you in the loop.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We’ll do the same.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So I’ve got Ryan and Esposito looking into Sara’s movements from last night. I figure if we can find out what she was doing in lower Manhattan that could lead us to whoever killed Hasim.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Are you okay?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, yeah. I just – can’t imagine what they’re going through right now.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Do you think this is really about money?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Did a web search on El-Masri. He’s worth over $300 million.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, but still. Who hires an ex-commando to babysit their daughter?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’ve considered it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And I don’t doubt that. But did you see how he shut her down when she brought up enemies?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He just doesn’t want to believe the worst. And frankly, I can’t blame him.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey. So I just interviewed Sara’s roommate, Amber. She wasn’t any help with Hasim or the kidnapping. But she did say that Sara went out last night.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Where did she go?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: All she could remember was that it was some kind of science thing.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Okay, I found three science related events in lower Manhattan from last night. First, a sci-fi movie marathon in an art house theater 8 blocks from where Hasim got clocked.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Though by definition, science fiction is not science.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: It has the word in it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s – that’s an excellent point.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What are the other two?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Uh, a stargazing tour led by an actual astronomer and a speech from a scientist names Hayden Posner. Uh, in the ballroom of the Beaumont Hotel.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Dr. Posner. He’s an expert on climate change. Alexis bought me his book … which I still haven’t read.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And the Beaumont Hotel would explain why Sara was in lower Manhattan.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And she’s a marine biology major, which means she would be interested in climate change.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Let’s go.

utterance.speaker: MANAGER
utterance.content: Yes, I remember her. Very lovely young woman. Sara El-Masri, yes, she definitely attended. I checked her in myself.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did you notice anything unusual about her?

utterance.speaker: MANAGER
utterance.content: No. After Dr. Posner’s presentation she stayed for the Q and A, which went rather late, and then she left.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Any idea where she went?

utterance.speaker: MANAGER
utterance.content: All I know is that she exited the ballroom. I stayed on to set up for a wedding reception.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Did she speak with anyone?

utterance.speaker: MANAGER
utterance.content: Just the person she was with.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Who was that?

utterance.speaker: MANAGER
utterance.content: A young woman. They sat together. They seemed to be friends but I couldn’t tell you her name.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Do you think you could describe this woman?

utterance.speaker: MANAGER
utterance.content: Red hair, pale skin. Also very lovely.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Can I – see that for a moment? It’s Alexis. She’s on the list. She was here last night.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, maybe she knows her, or maybe they met at the event.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: At the very least I’m sure she can help us out.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That’s her ringtone.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What’s that?

utterance.speaker: MANAGER
utterance.content: Our lost and found. In fact, a guest turned in a phone last night. They found it in the street out front.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: They took Alexis, too.

utterance.speaker: HARRIS
utterance.content: Mr. Castle, we will do everything in our power to get your daughter back.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I don’t want to be handled. Just let me know where things stand.

utterance.speaker: HARRIS
utterance.content: Let’s start with the facts as we now understand them. You daughter attended last night’s event with Sara El-Masri. Apparently they met in an environmental science class and became friends. GPS on her phone shows that it was left outside the hotel shortly after the event ended. That, plus the fact that no one has seen or heard from her in the 16 hours since, leads us to conclude that she too was forced into the van.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Now why would they take Alexis if Sara was the target?

utterance.speaker: HARRIS
utterance.content: She was probably with Sara at the time. She was a witness. It would have been easier to take her than – not.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So you’re saying she was just in the wrong place at the wrong time.

utterance.speaker: HARRIS
utterance.content: It appears that way.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Do you have any suspects?

utterance.speaker: HARRIS
utterance.content: We have a name. Facial recognition gave us an ID on the man in the video. Roger Henson. We know him mainly as a mid-level narcotics smuggler.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: If we know he’s out there we can get him. We can initiate a manhunt.

utterance.speaker: HARRIS
utterance.content: We’re already searching for Henson. Along with all his known associates. But he is a career felon. Finding him won’t be easy.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What’s a drug smuggler doing involved in a kidnapping?

utterance.speaker: HARRIS
utterance.content: We’re not sure. But Roger Henson is not a shot caller. He’s a middle man, a hired gun. He may have been hired to abduct the girls.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What happens now?

utterance.speaker: HARRIS
utterance.content: We press ahead on multiple fronts. We focus on Henson. Locating him could crack the case. We’re also creating contingency plans for when and if the kidnappers make contact.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: If? What do you mean, if?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We know that the El-Masris are wealthy and you told us Sara was the target.

utterance.speaker: HARRIS
utterance.content: Mr. El-Masri admitted he had close ties to the previous regime in Egypt. As a result, he made some very powerful enemies. It’s possible his daughter’s abduction was motivated by revenge.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay, where does that leave my daughter? I mean, if – if she wasn’t the one they were after then she’s just in the way.

utterance.speaker: HARRIS
utterance.content: Mr. Castle, you need to stay positive. Whatever their motives, the kidnappers will realize she has value. Now what we need to do next is go to your home and set up a trap and trace on your phone line so we’re ready for their call.

utterance.speaker: HARRIS
utterance.content: I’ll wait for you outside.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Gates will see.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I don’t care.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I can’t believe this is happening.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We’re gonna find her, Castle. We will.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: You do whatever you need to do to get him back his little girl. Anything you need, Detective.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Thank you, sir.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: How’s he doing?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: It’s Alexis. He’s gotta be wrecked. Hell, I’m wrecked.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah well, we’ve gotta put all of that aside and help him find her. Where are we on the van?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: We’ve been working the traffic cam footage and we’ve made some headway.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: After the van left lower Manhattan we picked it up on East River Drive heading toward the Queens-Midtown Tunnel.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We gotta figure out where that van went. Let’s bring in some more bodies to review the footage. We find the van, we find Alexis.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Let us know if you need anything.

utterance.speaker: FBI TECH GUY
utterance.content: Certainly, sir.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, Mother. I’m sorry. I am so sorry.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Richard. This is not your fault.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I don’t know. Maybe if I’d just –

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: No ifs. Do not torture yourself with ifs. The only people to blame for this are the ones that took her. Alexis is her father’s daughter. She is strong and she is smart and she is going to get through this.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, I know.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: No, no, no. I’m not just saying this. She’s going to be all right. I feel it in my heart and my heart is never wrong.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What about your first marriage?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Well …

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And your second?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Okay, fine. Fine. Occasionally my heart is wrong, but it is not in this case.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I just keep wondering, how did the kidnappers know Sara was going to be at the Beaumont Hotel?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: You have Kate Beckett and the FBI tracking Alexis down. Just let them do their job. And they need for you to be here.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What do you got?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: The van exited the Queens-to-Midtown tunnel to Greenpoint. Took Greenpoint Ave to McGuinness. They went west on Huron.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Then where did the van go?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well, we’re not sure. But this area right here? It’s pretty much boxed in by Greenpoint Ave, McGuinness, and Franklin.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: We checked the video feeds from those streets. The van went in but never came out.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: The girls have to be somewhere in there. Along with Henson.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, so how big is our search zone?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Twenty square blocks.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay. Coordinate with Feds and Queens PD. We need to do a street by street search for that van. Plain clothes and unmarked cars only.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: So, I’m sitting by the fountain on the south quad this morning, sipping my macchiato, trying to study for a chem quiz and I had this – I guess it was another freshman moment. I’m sure eventually I’ll become jaded and cynical, but not today. Today I look around and I see beautiful buildings. I see students that are just like me and nothing like me. And I feel … overwhelmed. With all the possibilities, with how lucky I am to be a part of this, and how there’s nowhere on Earth I’d rather be right now.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Now, stand by for a geek alert. My friend Sara and I got tickets to go see Dr. Posner speaks at the Beaumont tonight.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: And for those of you that don’t know, Dr. Posner is one of the foremost thinkers on climate change a personal hero of mine, and …

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Do you see? Are you watching?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, if the kidnappers knew that Alexis and Sara were friends –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: They did know. They had to know. They tracked Sara to the hotel from this video. Alexis posted it yesterday afternoon at 2:36. The kidnappers must have access to her website.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, I’m contacting tech right now.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Have them trace every IP address that accessed that site after 2:36PM.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Which might take time, depending on –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What if she doesn’t have time?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, listen to me –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Don’t. Don’t promise me you’ll find her unless you can do it. Because … … I would never forgive you. Any more than I’d ever forgive myself.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Beckett? We got something.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What’s that? Beckett? What’s going on?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, I gotta go. I’ll call you as soon as I find something, okay?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Beckett, wait –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay, thanks. Yeah, I will. That was LT from the precinct. He said all he knows is that they found the van parked since last night.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Well, Beckett will call you as soon as she has some news.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The van’s in Greenpoint. She would have gotten there over an hour ago. The only reason she wouldn’t have called –

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Stop it, Richard! We – we don’t know that.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh darling, go to Greenpoint. Go, go. I can handle things here.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle. What are you doing here?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The precinct told me you found the van. Why the hell wouldn’t you call me?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Because we don’t know what this is yet. Castle, please. You don’t need to see this.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What’s in the van?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, just please –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What’s in the van?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh – oh God.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Lanie, whose blood is that? Did someone die in there? Lanie, did she die in there?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, we don’t know, okay? Lanie just got here.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: What is Alexis’ blood type?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Okay, just give me a minute.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: C’mon. Let’s … go over here.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Is it a match?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: It’s B-. It’s not from your baby.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: God, thank you.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: I’m right there with you honey. I got to go let Agent Harris know.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So she’s safe, she’s here somewhere, right? She’s gotta be around her somewhere.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: She was. Castle, there was a blood trail that led from the van and it stopped. We think that the kidnappers changed cars.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Whose van is it?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It was stolen a week ago.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Any fingerprints?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: CSU’s looking. We’ve got uniforms canvassing the area. Castle, listen. If there is a lead, we are going to find it.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Beckett.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’ll be right back. Okay?

utterance.speaker: LINA
utterance.content: The blood. It’s not from Sara.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Not Alexis either.

utterance.speaker: ANWAR
utterance.content: Then there’s hope.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: ANWAR
utterance.content: I – I regret that your daughter was dragged into this.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What is it exactly they’ve been drawn into?

utterance.speaker: ANWAR
utterance.content: I wish I knew.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Sara? Sara? Sara, are you okay?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: I don’t know.

utterance.speaker: SARA
utterance.content: Wait. The speech. The hotel. We left the hotel and then that guy … he forced us into a van and then … … oh, it’s all a bit of a blur.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: I think we were drugged.

utterance.speaker: SARA
utterance.content: We still have our clothes on. That’s a good sign.

utterance.speaker: SARA
utterance.content: This is all my fault. My parents warned me about this since they first sent me to boarding school. They even made me sit through a lecture on kidnapping from the head of corporate security.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Wait, why would someone kidnap you?

utterance.speaker: SARA
utterance.content: My father’s crazy rich. But the good news is that he’ll pay the ransom. I mean, that’s what this must be, right?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Right.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: And my dad will find us. He works with the police. I’m sure he’s looking for us right now.

utterance.speaker: SARA
utterance.content: So they’ll get us out of here.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Wonder what’s in there.

utterance.speaker: SARA
utterance.content: Okay, this is creepy.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Clothes? Towels? At least this means they want us alive.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: See? They’re taking care of us.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That was Agent Harris. A witness saw a black Yukon leaving Greenpoint just after the van arrived. Kidnappers must have switched over to the Yukon.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: They’ve got a 24 hour head start. They could be anywhere by now. Where’s CSU on the blood?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, spatter analysis shows that it came from the driver. He was shot by Hasim.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He would have left prints in the van. He must be in the system.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, CSU only found Roger Henson’s prints. There’s no other matches.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: We must have a lead here somewhere.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Maybe we do. CSU inspected the van. Found that a bunch of performance tweaks were done to it. Octane booster in the tank, catalytic converter was bypassed, the ECU was rechipped to boot up the horsepower.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Somebody upgraded it to a getaway car.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Not just somebody. A real pro. Probably our driver.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, look for a man whose MO is to steal getaway cars and retune them. Someone with B- blood.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Right.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: That security guy. You said he talked to you about kidnapping. What kind of stuff did he say?

utterance.speaker: SARA
utterance.content: What if no one’s looking for us? What if they don’t even realize that we’re gone?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Sara, let’s focus on the questions that we can answer. Build on what we know.

utterance.speaker: SARA
utterance.content: We don’t know anything! That’s the problem. We don’t know who took us, or for how long we’ll be here, or even where we are.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Okay, well, let’s figure that out. Let’s figure out where we are. Um … … hear that? There’s space under the floor. So we’re not in a basement.

utterance.speaker: SARA
utterance.content: And this is a much older building. Based on how worn the floor is.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: And there’s the sound.

utterance.speaker: SARA
utterance.content: What sound?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Exactly. No car honks, no traffic noise. Either this room is seriously soundproof or we’re not in New York.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Looks like your hunch paid off. Douglas Stevens. He did a nickel as a getaway driver for a bank robbery and guess who did time with him. None other than Roger Henson.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Do the prison records show his blood type?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, I’m going to put out an APB and alert all hospitals. With the amount of blood that he lost he’s going to need medical treatment.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: He might not need a hospital. Douglas Stevens has a sister who’s a nurse. Guess who called in sick today?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: NYPD! Open up!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We’re here for your brother.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah well, we’re not going to take your word for it.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Actually ma’am, we can.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: NYPD! Don’t move! Douglas Stevens, you are under arrest.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The girls that you took. Where are they? Where’s your partner Roger Henson? Who put the two of you up to this?

utterance.speaker: DOUGLAS STEVENS
utterance.content: I got nothing to say.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well then, you’re going to go down for all of it. You were driving the van. That’s murder, two counts of kidnapping. Do you know how many years you’re going to be in jail for? It’s in the triple digits. Tell us where the girls are. That’s your only hope.

utterance.speaker: STEVENS
utterance.content: Let me know when my ambulance gets here.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’d like a minute with him.

utterance.speaker: STEVENS
utterance.content: I just said I don’t want to talk. So you can’t question me. I have rights. I’m not going to say anything without a lawyer.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m not a cop.

utterance.speaker: STEVENS
utterance.content: Then who are you?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You remember the girl with the red hair? I’m her father.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Please know, I will do whatever it takes to get her back. Those police outside are my friends. My daughter’s friends, too. So it’s just you and me.

utterance.speaker: STEVENS
utterance.content: If you touch me I’ll press charges.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I don’t care. Where are they?

utterance.speaker: STEVENS
utterance.content: I’m just a driver. I – I don’t know anything.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: We know Henson ditched the van for the black Yukon. So where did he go? Where did he take the girls? I won’t ask you again. Where did he take the girls?

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: The address Stevens gave you is to a farm off Route 301. That’s 60 miles north from here. Agent Harris and a tactical team are heading to the location.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Already?

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: They should be arriving at the farm any moment.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And what will they do then?

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Whatever is necessary to recover Alexis and her friend. But I’ll let you know the moment I have any news.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Do you want a coffee?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No. No, thanks. My adrenaline will suffice.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did you find out who owns the farm?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Nobody. The property’s been tied up in foreclosure since 2009. It’s been sitting empty. It’s isolated.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Look, the FBI knows what they’re doing. They’re trained in hostage rescue. Alexis is in the best possible hands.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I’m tied into state police dispatch. Feds are on the scene now.

utterance.speaker: HARRIS
utterance.content: That’s our SUV.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Okay, sooner or later someone will show up to bring us more food and we need to be prepared. So what did that security guy tell you?

utterance.speaker: SARA
utterance.content: Avoid eye contact with the captors so they don’t perceive you to be a witness.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Good. What else?

utterance.speaker: SARA
utterance.content: Be vulnerable. Try to let the captors see you as human. Someone they can relate to. Try to build up trust, build a relationship.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: How are we supposed to build a relationship without eye contact?

utterance.speaker: SARA
utterance.content: That’s a good question.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The minute she knows, you’ll know.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I just wish that minute was now. It’s all happening too fast and too slow at the same time.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Tell me what happened with Douglas Stevens.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I appealed to his humanity.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I didn’t think you had that side to you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, when it comes to the people I love, I do.

utterance.speaker: CAPTOR
utterance.content: Put the food tray under the door.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: My name’s Alexis. This is Sara.

utterance.speaker: CAPTOR
utterance.content: Put the food tray under the door.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: It’s kind of cold in here. Is there any way we could get some more blankets?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: What just happened?

utterance.speaker: SARA
utterance.content: The man on the radio? He was speaking Arabic. He said, “Return to your post. We have visitors.”

utterance.speaker: HARRIS
utterance.content: Go! Go, go, go, go!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You know, I still remember … when Alexis was born they handed me this tiny person, all bundled up. She just … stared up at me. And when I looked down at her, this feeling hit me. Like I’d been struck by lightning. It was love. That instant, inexplicable love you can only feel for your child.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: In that moment I knew. I knew my life had changed forever. And now it’s about to change again.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Gates. Okay. The farmhouse was empty.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Alexis and Sara aren’t there.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Are you sure she’s not in the cellar or some hidden room somewhere?

utterance.speaker: HARRIS
utterance.content: We searched top to bottom. They’re gone. We did find these. Either of them belong to Alexis?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, that one there. That’s … that’s hers. What does it mean that her coat’s here and she’s not?

utterance.speaker: HARRIS
utterance.content: This must have been a way station until they moved the girls someplace else.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: They’ve been one step ahead of us this whole time.

utterance.speaker: HARRIS
utterance.content: These people that we’re dealing with are sophisticated. There are webcams outside. Our approach was streamed to an anonymous IP address. That same IP accessed your daughter’s website.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And you can’t trace it?

utterance.speaker: HARRIS
utterance.content: It was routed across four continents. We’re not optimistic.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What about Roger Henson?

utterance.speaker: HARRIS
utterance.content: He was shot to death after being tortured at length by someone who knew what they were doing.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: His fingernails were pulled off.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I don’t understand. Henson was working for the kidnappers. Why would they torture him?

utterance.speaker: HARRIS
utterance.content: I don’t know.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well then, what do you think? What is your best guess as to what this means for Alexis? For the girls?

utterance.speaker: HARRIS
utterance.content: It means getting them back may be a little more complicated.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Were you crying in there?

utterance.speaker: SARA
utterance.content: I thought the running water would cover it up.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: We’ll be all right, Sara.

utterance.speaker: SARA
utterance.content: I thought this was all about the money. But these people speak Arabic. My father is a hated man back in Egypt.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: We need to get out of here.

utterance.speaker: SARA
utterance.content: The only way out is through that door and it’s locked.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Hey, are those … bobby pins?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: There are hopeful signs here, Castle. They’ve gone out of their way not to harm the girls. They want them alive. That’ll give us time to track down whoever is behind this.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: How? Our main suspect is dead. The only thing Stevens knew is where the farmhouse is, and … we have no idea who we’re looking for.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The FBI is searching the farm for evidence. They’re canvassing the area for witnesses that might have seen whoever was on the property.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: All of which is just another way of saying that we’re back to square one.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Won’t be the first time. We’re gonna solve this, Castle. We will find a way. We’ve done it before with less to go on. You know who told me that.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I did. In a fit of irrational optimism.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, go see your mom. Go home, get some rest. Come back in the morning. No one is giving up here.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I can’t. I’m –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Here’s a decaf. It’s for the road.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: SARA
utterance.content: It’s been hours now.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: My dad taught me how to do this when he was researching for one of his books. He actually bought a door for us to practice on.

utterance.speaker: SARA
utterance.content: This was recently?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: I was 10.

utterance.speaker: SARA
utterance.content: Oh God.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: I can do this. One bobby pin is the torsion wrench, the other is the lock pick. You just have to be careful not to apply too much pressure –

utterance.speaker: SARA
utterance.content: Did you just break the hairpin? Because that’s the last one.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: No. I got it.

utterance.speaker: SARA
utterance.content: Oh my God!

utterance.speaker: SARA
utterance.content: What’s out there?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: A hallway. Like in an office building. I don’t see anyone.

utterance.speaker: SARA
utterance.content: What if they catch us? Then what?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: They want us alive. Just remember that. Here’s the plan. We head down the hall. There has to be a way out. If it looks like there’s two ways we split up and double our chances that one of us makes it out.

utterance.speaker: SARA
utterance.content: I think I’m going to throw up.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: You’re not going to throw up. You’re going to get out of here.

utterance.speaker: SARA
utterance.content: Okay. Okay.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: C’mon.

utterance.speaker: SARA
utterance.content: No, no.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: We talked about this! Go!

utterance.speaker: FBI TECH GUY
utterance.content: Were you expecting someone to Skype you?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Alexis!

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Daddy? Oh my God!

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: I tried to call 911 but it wouldn’t go through.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Baby, are you okay? Where are you?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: I don’t know. The phone’s about to die. Um … I – we’re - we’re in some building. We were locked in a room but we got out.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Where? What building? What’s out – what’s outside the window?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Nothing, nothing – I can’t see outside – the windows are covered up.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: They’re coming. They’re coming. They found out we’re gone.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Baby, get out of there. Get out of there now. Go! Go!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Can you tell where the call’s coming from?

utterance.speaker: FBI TECH GUY
utterance.content: Tracking now.

utterance.speaker: FBI TECH GUY
utterance.content: This can’t be right.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Why? What is it?

utterance.speaker: FBI TECH GUY
utterance.content: This says that the call originated from a cell tower in … Paris, France.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Help!
